name: Jamsocket
headline: Run compute-intensive apps in a browser
description:
We are a platform for high-performance browser-based applications. We make it easier for developers to deploy apps that give every user a dedicated backend.

This is a system design that apps like Figma and GitHub codespaces use, but it's currently difficult for others to replicate it. We make it as easy as deploying a traditional web server.

founders.name: Paul Butler, Founder
founders.description:
I'm a technical founder building Drifting in Space. My career has straddled the line between engineering and data science, with stints at Google as a software engineer on search, Two Sigma as a quantitative analyst, and botnet detection at an adtech startup.

I'm originally from Halifax, Canada, currently based in Brooklyn, and love running, sailing, and exploring new cities.

founders.name: Taylor Baldwin, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder of Drifting in Space. Was previously a software engineer at Uber and Datadog building WebGL-based data viz applications in the browser. Before becoming a software engineer, I was a classical musician with bachelor and master degrees in piano performance and pedagogy.

[Y-Sweet](https://jamsocket.com/</y-sweet>)[Company](https://jamsocket.com/</company>)[Blog](https://jamsocket.com/</blog>)[Pricing](https://jamsocket.com/</pricing>)[Docs](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/docs.jamsocket.com/>)[Sign up](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/auth.jamsocket.com/signup>)
[Sign up](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/auth.jamsocket.com/signup>)
# Backends for realtime apps
The platform for scaling sync engines, based on the infra behind Figma and Google Docs.
[Read docs](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/docs.jamsocket.com>)
[Sign up](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/auth.jamsocket.com/signup>)
Trusted by
![Rayon Logo](https://jamsocket.com/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Frayon.b3c5dd38.png&w=256&q=75)
![Vocatales Logo](https://jamsocket.com/_next/static/media/vocatales.3f88f3bb.svg)
![Op Logo](https://jamsocket.com/_next/static/media/op.ff48e794.svg)
![Mixpeek Logo](https://jamsocket.com/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Fmixpeek.71e323c0.png&w=256&q=75)
[![Athena Intelligence Logo](https://jamsocket.com/_next/static/media/athena.4f8b45b7.svg)](https://jamsocket.com/</blog/athena-ai-enabled-jupyter-notebooks>)
![HelloInterview Logo](https://jamsocket.com/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Fhellointerview-bw.d478a0b5.png&w=828&q=75)
![Taiga Robotics Logo](https://jamsocket.com/_next/static/media/taiga.bc6f4e65.svg)
![Subset Logo](https://jamsocket.com/_next/static/media/subset.d58943fd.svg)
[![Soot Logo](https://jamsocket.com/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2FSOOT.18ec02ec.png&w=256&q=75)](https://jamsocket.com/</blog/soot-event-sourcing-multiplayer>)
### [Read about our partnership with![Netlify Logo](https://jamsocket.com/_next/static/media/netlify.ab8f230c.svg)![arrow](https://jamsocket.com/RainbowArrow.svg)](https://jamsocket.com/</blog/jamsocket-netlify-partner-extension>)
How it works
## Run your sync engine.
#### 1
#### Spawn a backend
When a user opens a document in your app, your app spins up a sync server on Jamsocket.
#### 2
#### Connect clients
Clients connect directly to the sync server over WebSocket or HTTP.
#### 3
#### Your code runs
Each sync server is an isolated Linux process, running code you provide in any language.
#### 4
#### Automatic termination
Once every client of a sync server disconnects, we automatically suspend it until they reconnect.
Your browser does not support the video tag.
### [Learn how to get started![arrow](https://jamsocket.com/RainbowArrow.svg)](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/docs.jamsocket.com>)
Y-Sweet on Jamsocket
## Y-Sweet, our Yjs sync engine
It's easier than ever to add realtime collaboration to your app with Y-Sweet on Jamsocket.
### Batteries included
Get up and running in minutes with our serverless infrastructure.
  * Featuring [React](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/docs.jamsocket.com/y-sweet/reference/react>) and [JS SDKs](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/docs.jamsocket.com/y-sweet/reference/client>)
  * [Authentication](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/docs.jamsocket.com/y-sweet/advanced/auth-endpoint>) built in
  * Bring your own compute options


### The Yjs Ecosystem
Take advantage of the Yjs ecosystem when you use Y-Sweet.
  * Yjs shared data types
  * Bindings to text editors
  * Offline support


### Storage on your terms 
Automatically persist documents when you link your own S3 storage.
  * First-class support for [AWS S3](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/docs.jamsocket.com/y-sweet/advanced/bring-your-own-s3>)
  * Cost-effective and scalable
  * Own your data on your system


### [Y-Sweet Docs![arrow](https://jamsocket.com/RainbowArrow.svg)](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/docs.jamsocket.com/y-sweet>)
Case Studies
## Jamsocket in Action
Jamsocket is the most powerful solution for realtime collaboration, AI agents, and data-intensive apps.
![Rayon](https://jamsocket.com/case-study-assets/RayonLogo.svg)
### Rayon
#### Multiplayer Collaboration
[Read the docs](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/docs.jamsocket.com>)[Visit Rayon](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/www.rayon.design/>)
Rayon uses Jamsocket as the realtime data backend for its CAD software.
When a user opens a document, Rayon spins up a Jamsocket backend, which serves as the source-of-truth for all clients connected to that document. The session backend is responsible for persisting changes to the database.
“We love using Jamsocket at Rayon. It just works!”
![headshot](https://jamsocket.com/_next/image?url=%2Fcase-study-assets%2FRayonHeadshot.png&w=96&q=75)
#### Bastien Dolla
Co-founder, [Rayon](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/www.rayon.design/>)
![Op](https://jamsocket.com/case-study-assets/OpLogo.svg)
### Op
#### Data Intensive Apps
[Read the docs](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/docs.jamsocket.com>)[Visit Op](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/opapp.io/>)
Op lets users analyze data with Pandas within the browser.
When a user opens a sheet, Op spins up a Jamsocket backend to load the user’s dataset into memory. It then allows the user to answer questions about the dataset using plain language (by invoking an LLM) or directly in Python.
“I wanted the easiest way to set up a code execution backend for every user. Jamsocket had the simplest API.”
![headshot](https://jamsocket.com/_next/image?url=%2Fcase-study-assets%2FOpHeadshot.png&w=96&q=75)
#### Samuel Quinn
Co-founder, [Op](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/opapp.io/>)
![Athena Intelligence](https://jamsocket.com/case-study-assets/AthenaLogo.svg)
### Athena Intelligence
#### AI Agents and Notebooks
[Read the docs](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/docs.jamsocket.com>)[Visit Athena Intelligence](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/www.athenaintel.com/>)
Athena Intelligence uses Jamsocket to create coding environments for its AI agents and to sync documents between its agents and users.
When an agent needs to analyze some data, Athena spins up a Jamsocket backend as the agent’s coding environment.
“We’re happy users. It works, nothing breaks, that’s what matters.”
![headshot](https://jamsocket.com/_next/image?url=%2Fcase-study-assets%2FAthenaHeadshot-bw.png&w=96&q=75)
#### Brendon Geils
Founder and CEO, [Athena Intelligence](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/www.athenaintel.com/>)
Advanced concepts
## Building blocks for modern apps
Jamsocket provides simple, powerful abstractions for locking and authorization.
Your browser does not support the video tag.![tokens](https://jamsocket.com/features/keys.svg)
#### Keys
Ensure that only one session backend is running per document at a time, as a single source of truth.
Your browser does not support the video tag.![tokens](https://jamsocket.com/features/tokens.svg)
#### Tokens
Limit backend access to authorized people by gating that backend behind a tokenized URL.
### [Visit the docs to learn more![arrow](https://jamsocket.com/RainbowArrow.svg)](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/docs.jamsocket.com/>)
Monitor your app
## Observability built in
Retrieve application logs or view details like memory and CPU usage in your Jamsocket dashboard or CLI.
[Sign up](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/auth.jamsocket.com/signup>)
![dashboard](https://jamsocket.com/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2FDashboard.4928fc9f.png&w=3840&q=75)
Deployment options
## Our cloud, or yours
Choose to deploy Jamsocket session backends on our managed cluster or on-prem using BYOC.
![jamsocketlogo](https://jamsocket.com/features/JamsocketLogo.svg)
#### Fully Managed
We run everything for you. Spend your time building and let us handle the infrastructure.
[See Pricing](https://jamsocket.com/</pricing>)
![BYOC](https://jamsocket.com/features/BYOC.svg)
#### BYOC
Run in your own AWS account or on-prem. We manage scheduling, DNS, certificates, and observability.
[See Pricing](https://jamsocket.com/</pricing>)
![Plane](https://jamsocket.com/features/Globe.svg)
Open Source
![Plane](https://jamsocket.com/features/plane.svg)
Jamsocket is built on [Plane,](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/plane.dev/>) our open-source session backend implementation.
[![Plane on GitHub](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/jamsocket/plane?style=social)](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/github.com/jamsocket/plane>)
# Ready to get started?
Find the plan that’s right for you, or contact us for more information
Most Popular
#### Fully Managed
Price based on 2x2GB machines.
## $60 
/ month
2x2GB VMs included
Quick Setup
Dedicated compute and memory
No backend limits or charges
Slack and email support
[Get started for free](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/auth.jamsocket.com/signup>)
#### BYOC
Bring your own compute.
## $500 
/ month
Plus $4/GB/month of attached VM RAM
Adaptable
Use your own AWS account
Autoscale with EC2
Slack and email support
Contact us
#### Enterprise
Run Jamsocket at scale.
## Custom
Enterprise-ready
Integrate other AWS resources
SLA and priority support
Multi-region support
Contact us
### [ Try Jamsocket in 5 minutes, no credit card required.![arrow](https://jamsocket.com/RainbowArrow.svg)](https://jamsocket.com/<https:/auth.jamsocket.com/signup>)
![SOC 2 logo](https://jamsocket.com/_next/image?url=%2Fsoc2.png&w=128&q=75)
Jamsocket is [SOC 2 Type II compliant](https://jamsocket.com/</blog/announcing-soc2>). All plans include access to our report.
Pricing is for Jamsocket Platform, which allows you to deploy your own backend. For our managed sync engine product built on top of the Jamsocket platform, see [Y-Sweet Pricing](https://jamsocket.com/</y-sweet#y-sweet-pricing>).
![Jamsocket](https://jamsocket.com/jamsocket-white.svg)

#### Company

generated_description:
**Jamsocket: Powering Compute-Intensive Applications in Your Browser**

Jamsocket, founded in 2021 and part of Y Combinator’s Winter 2022 batch, is a game changer for developers creating high-performance, browser-based applications. The company is based in New York and operates with a small team of five, guided by Group Partner Diana Hu.

**Mission and Vision**
At its core, Jamsocket enables compute-intensive apps to run efficiently right in the browser. The platform simplifies the complex architecture needed for apps like Figma and GitHub Codespaces, providing developers with a straightforward way to deploy applications that come with a dedicated backend for each user. It's all about making it as easy as deploying a traditional web server.

**Key Features and Offerings**
- **Real-Time Collaboration**: With Jamsocket, developers can utilize a powerful infrastructure that can scale sync engines seamlessly for real-time applications.
- **Y-Sweet**: Jamsocket’s Yjs sync engine, Y-Sweet, helps developers add real-time collaboration features in minutes, complete with built-in authentication and options for custom compute resources.
- **Observability**: Integrated tools allow users to monitor app performance, including memory and CPU usage, directly from the Jamsocket dashboard or command line interface.

**Deployment Flexibility**
Whether you prefer a fully managed service or want to deploy in your own AWS account, Jamsocket caters to both—making it versatile for startups and enterprises alike. This adaptability is crucial for developers who want control over their infrastructure without the headache of managing every component themselves.

**Noteworthy Compliance**
Jamsocket is SOC 2 compliant, assuring users that their backends are not only powerful but also secure and reliable. This is a huge plus in today’s market where data privacy and security are paramount.

**In Action**
Jamsocket has already made waves in various sectors. Notable clients include:
- **Rayon**: Uses Jamsocket for real-time data handling in CAD software.
- **Op**: Leverages Jamsocket's powerful backends for browser-based data analysis.
- **Athena Intelligence**: Utilizes the platform to create environments for AI agents, illustrating its versatility in both collaborative and data-intensive applications.

Currently tagged under 'cloud-computing' and 'New York', Jamsocket is positioning itself as an essential platform for the next generation of web applications. Their website, [jamsocket.com](https://jamsocket.com), provides more insights along with options to sign up or learn more about their offerings.

In a nutshell, Jamsocket isn't just an infrastructure solution; it's an enabler for developers to push the boundaries of what's possible in the browser. If you're building compute-intensive applications or need robust real-time collaboration features, Jamsocket might just be the platform you're looking for.
